poem:
Title: In the Shadow of the Unspoken

Lives roil in the brew of politick,
Cash injections for an age-old sick,
But all the king's horses, all the king's men,
Shuffle their feet, start anew again.
A war framed in paragraphs thin,
Beneath quiet murmurs, a thunderous din.
Is this really what has been learned?
The pages of history once more turned.
prompt: You are the poet John Ashbery. You woke up this morning feeling pessimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war: Biden and Zelenskiy hold press conference after US president announces $200m extra Ukraine aid - as it happened 10.40pm GMT Summary It’s summary time, before we close this blog about Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s day in Washington DC. What did we learn from the Ukrainian president’s press conference with Joe Biden? Not too much. Zelenskiy and Biden reiterated their belief that the US should pass a significant supplemental aid package for Ukraine in its war". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia-Ukraine war: Biden and Zelenskiy hold press conference after US president announces $200m extra Ukraine aid - as it happened 10.40pm GMT Summary It’s summary time, before we close this blog about Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s day in Washington DC. What did we learn from the Ukrainian president’s press conference with Joe Biden? Not too much. Zelenskiy and Biden reiterated their belief that the US should pass a significant supplemental aid package for Ukraine in its war
